TopicTitle: Rover controls should be separate from pitch/roll/yaw

Articles.Content:
As it says on the title. As it currently stands, if you press W to go forward, you also pitch down (and even disabling the command pod torque causes that? I guess that part is a bug). In KSP 1, the key binds could be remapped to different keys, so you could drive around without tilting the rovers.

The wheels should also have more traction.
If you disable the reaction wheels, then it should be fine.  I do this in KSP1 and never had an issue.  Maybe your experiencing a bug?

I've already put in a request for this with the devs. This is a must for me as I use a HOTAS setup. In KSP1 I set up steering to be the same as yaw (twisting the joystick) and forward/reverse to a paddle on the throttle. In KSP 2 I can't yet map yaw and throttle to the HOTAS, but at least pitch and roll can. It's a bit hit and miss as to whether the other buttons remember to work, and the map toggle only opens the map, still need to use M to close it.

Again we are re-living KSP 1 times. This was an issue in KSP 1, then they added a separate keybind for steering, to allow what OP wants.

This is a must to have.
